member.name: T:Orleans.TestingHost.Utils.StorageEmulator
member.summary: A wrapper on Azure Storage Emulator.
member.remarks: It might be tricky to implement this as a IDisposable, isolated, autonomous instance, see at Use the Azure Storage Emulator for Development and Testing for pointers.

member.name: F:Orleans.TestingHost.Utils.StorageEmulator.storageEmulatorProcessNames
member.summary: The storage emulator process name. One way to enumerate running process names is Get-Process | Format-Table Id, ProcessName -autosize. If there were multiple storage emulator processes running, they would named WASTOR~1, WASTOR~2, ... WASTOR~n.

member.returns: TRUE if the process was started sucessfully. FALSE otherwise.

member.summary: Starts the storage emulator if not already started.
member.returns: TRUE if the process was stopped succesfully or was already started. FALSE otherwise.

member.summary: Stops the storage emulator if started.
member.returns: TRUE if the process was stopped succesfully or was already stopped. FALSE otherwise.

member.name: T:Orleans.TestingHost.TestCluster
member.summary: A host class for local testing with Orleans using in-process silos. Runs a Primary and optionally secondary silos in separate app domains, and client in the main app domain. Additional silos can also be started in-process on demand if required for particular test cases.
member.remarks: Make sure that your test project references your test grains and test grain interfaces projects, and has CopyLocal=True set on those references [which should be the default].

member.summary: Primary silo handle

member.name: T:Orleans.TestingHost.TestingSiloHost
member.summary:
Important note: will be eventually deprectated. It is recommended that you use instead. A host class for local testing with Orleans using in-process silos.
Runs a Primary and Secondary silo in seperate app domains, and client in the main app domain. Additional silos can also be started in-process if required for particular test cases.
member.remarks:
Make sure the following files are included in any test projects that use TestingSiloHost, and ensure "Copy if Newer" is set to ensure the config files are included in the test set.
OrleansConfigurationForTesting.xml ClientConfigurationForTesting.xml
Also make sure that your test project references your test grains and test grain interfaces projects, and has CopyLocal=True set on those references [which should be the default].
